snippet: Giant eucalyptus trees share traits with rain forest trees and should be reclassified, a study says, a move that may help save them from overharvesting.
abstract: Dr David  Bowman study in journal New Phytologist concludes that Australia's giant eucalyptus trees, tallest flowering plants on earth, should be classified as a species of rain forest tree.
lead_paragraph: Giant eucalyptus trees share traits with rain forest trees and should be reclassified, a study says, a move that may help save them from overharvesting.

headline.print_headline: Giant Eucalyptus Trees Earn Rain Forest Stripes
headline.seo: Giant Eucalyptus Trees E arn Rain Forest Stripes
headline.main: Giant Eucalyptus Trees Earn Rain Forest Stripes
